alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 01 at 2:01PM PST until February 03 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THURSDAY TO 4 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...South winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE... Central and Eastern Lake County. This includes highway 31 near Summer Lake, highway 395 near Valley Falls and exposed sections of 140 in the Warner Mountains. * WHEN...From 4 PM Thursday to 4 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Driving high profile vehicles may be difficult at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind gusts will only impact higher terrain Thursday night. The stronger winds will mix down to the valley floors later Friday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
